intro: Kedrostis abdallae, commonly known as the African arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and squash. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that develop into spiny, orange fruits. The fruits contain a starchy, edible tuberous root that is used as a food source. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
